result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn E Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
75 days Marquette County Jail with huber, consecutive to any other sentence.Defendant to remain in custody.
Sentence to commence forthwith. May transfer to Sauk County.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn E Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cancel Warrant.  Fine paid in full 4/20/16.  smr
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Shawn E Miller in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shawn E Miller in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is resolved today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 75 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Defendant is to remain in custody and begin sentence forthwith
May transfer to Sauk County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 surcharge
Credit = 31 days
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in August.

  Court advises defendant of DNA Sample requirement per statute.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets Return/Pre-trial.

Defendant Shawn E Miller in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee states that there is a Felony Warrant out of Sauk County.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions.

  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
